Description: Fragment of East Greek pottery bowl; slipped. On interior, a leftward key maeander band on broad reserved area; glazed to the centre. On exterior two bands of thinned glaze remain. Large white inclusions in the clay.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 31, no. 114 pl. 30)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.141)
